text:
Martín Alberto Vizcarra Cornejo (born 22 March 1963) is a Peruvian engineer and politician. He was the 67th President of Peru following the resignation of President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski. He previously served as the Vice President of Peru alongside Mercedes Aráoz.
Demanding reforms against corruption, Vizcarra dissolved the Congress of Peru on 30 September 2019 and, the next day, issued a decree for legislative elections to be held on 26 January 2020.
On 9 November 2020, Vizcarra was impeached and removed as President by the Congress and replaced with Manuel Merino.
